New Records: Mohammad Rizwan scored 57 runs off 43 balls for Pakistan.
Shaheen Shah Afridi was the MVP with 65.84 impact points.
Key Match Events: Pakistan won the match by 7 wickets with 5 balls remaining.
Mohammad Haris made his debut and played a significant role in Pakistan's victory.
New Zealand dropped crucial catches, including one of Babar Azam.
The match was Pakistan's turnaround story after early tournament struggles.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and elected to bat first.
Pakistan's bowling attack was clinical in the latter part of the innings.
The match was played at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson expressed frustration with the team's performance.
Matthew Hayden praised Pakistan's bowling attack and young players like Mohammad Haris.
The match marked Pakistan's unexpected qualification for the final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Pakistan's second win in the tournament after initially struggling.
The result was a surprise given New Zealand's strong performance in the group stage.
The game was a historic moment for Pakistan's cricket.
Others: The match was part of the 2022-23 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
